data.title: Added the Thumper infantry
data.body: See http://dune2k.com/Duniverse/Games/Dune2000/Details/Units for reference.

data.title: Added high quality Tiberian Dawn community maps
data.body:
I am a bit unhappy about the Tiberian Dawn map selection. There are a lot of maps lacking detail or innovation as they are just remakes of existing ones which add more spawns or a bit more surrounding terrain mostly from the same author. They also tend to be very symmetric to ease balancing which makes them look less interesting. We probably need to do a https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/4817 there as well when the time is right.

This adds some awesome community maps I found and test played with @abcdefg30, @obrakmann, @pchote and @penev92 or against random opponents. They seemed to also work out in terms of gameplay. Some also make use of the new JUNGLE tileset which adds some diversity. They are not too easy to find, because the resource site does not let you filter by mod yet https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA-Resources/issues/23 and there are a lot of RA maps in the repository.

Source:
- http://resource.openra.net/maps/2702/
- ~~http://resource.openra.net/maps/1652/~~
- ~~http://resource.openra.net/maps/2861/~~
- http://resource.openra.net/maps/1382/
- ~~http://resource.openra.net/maps/1449/~~
- http://resource.openra.net/maps/2647/
- http://resource.openra.net/maps/1403/
- http://resource.openra.net/maps/1375/

data.title: Rebalanced stat gains from rank-up
data.body:
It was mentioned on IRC that the first, relatively powerful rank-up allows jeeps, for example, to safely bring infantry like spies and engineers to enemy buildings.

This is mainly because the firepower, armor and speed bonuses are about 10% each on first rank-up, whereas the next two, harder to reach rank-ups only add 4-5%.

This lowers the initial buffs, generally flattens the 'armor' curve for level-ups, and lowers the maximum bonus for armor and speed.

data.title: TS vanilla rocket explosions
data.body:
-- Uses vanilla TS explosions when impacting the ground
-- All use twlt variants in the air with their vanilla sound effects (this is not vanilla but "<+Mailaender> It think it is required to indicate hits on aircraft." and it's not a bad idea)

data.body: Fixes https://github.com/csMACnz/coveritypublisher/issues/13.

data.title: Fixed ground level checks for immobile actors
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/9011.

> Also fixes #9013.

data.title: Units don't enter Buildings with the Cargo Trait
data.body: To test this, either assign a Building with the Cargo Trait or empty a pillbox in red alert. The enter Arrow will display but the Unit refuses to enter the Building.

data.title: Vehicle tilt on slopes and bumps
data.body: Add the moment they glide with no change in angle.

data.title: Crushing walls with Mammoth tanks doesn't work (anymore)
data.body: See http://resource.openra.net/maps/4045/ for a test map with enemy owned walls.

data.title: Unit cancel movement orders when path is temporarily blocked
data.body: Sometimes, when the unit path is blocked by another unit, the unit will stop moving at all.

data.title: Aircraft have wrong minimap cursor
data.body:
Planes have attack cursor for airfields and helicopters for helipad. When clicked, they land and don't attack it.

data.title: Playtest AI issues
data.body:
Latest Playtest 2015 08 08

First of all congratulations with this update, it makes many things better. Thanks for the hard work!

The problems I came across while testing:

AI makes 18 (some are out of screen) harvesters with only 2 refineries, but not a single unit to defend himself: (his base builiding was destroyed earlier)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6690499/9152840/9b33db74-3e39-11e5-8a7b-90f820f823da.png)

Subs from AI are dropping performance heavily.
The game was very slow, so I started to look for the reason (I first suspected the wall across the map, but it wasn't it). Once I killed all units on land except a few buildings, I started at sea, each boat I destroyed the game got back faster and faster. I have a modern fast computer, SSD hard drive, 16GB Ram, etc so on a slower pc the game wouldn't have been playable at all.

To give an idea: Sub Pen + 6 subs remaining: huge drop in performance, all other units and buildings from that party destroyed. After destroying the sub pen (boats get destroyed with it), performance is back normal. (at the end part of the game, the green player upper right side of the map)

I couldn't wait till the end in the replay to take screenshots at the end, as due to the slow performance it took takes, but see spikes herein performance due to boats:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6690499/9152912/597dd546-3e3d-11e5-8ffa-9e98ef7a904b.png)

Replay: https://drive.google.com/file/d/0BynHp26MoAw-eVpmME5VS0dDQ0E/view?usp=sharing (you can download the file at the top center of that page) and then extract it with an application like 7zip.
The map was: http://resource.openra.net/maps/758/

Thanks again for the great update and thanks for looking into this.

data.title: Made Armor upgradable
data.body: This allows to change armor on levelup, and even add additional armor types.

data.title: Remove legacy 0% = not targetable assumption
data.body: None of the first-party mods use the above assumption anymore as far as I could tell, so we might as well remove it now.

data.title: AttackGarisoned defenses use fixed range circles when placing while actual range is based on occupant
data.body:
The most robust solution would be to check `CargoInfo.InitialUnits`, `AttackGarrisonedInfo.Armaments`, `ArmamentInfo.Name` (occupant), and `ArmamentInfo.Weapon` (occupant) as well as the weapon info.

Repro by parking a vehicle in front of the factory door. It seems to work when something that has just been produced stops moving, however.

data.title: Fixed missile shadow on elevated terrain
data.body: Looks like neither me nor the reviewers tested missiles in TS properly in #8923.

data.title: Support streaming from zip format
data.body:
The current zip file loader copies the content of the entire file into memory during opening which is ineffective, and although so far caused no problems, would be a problem for a bigger mod if it decides to ship everything in zip files - for the matter, I could get an out of memory error when my 450 MB music pack was in a zip package.

I'd even say streaming should be a prerequisite of the long-term plan to replace mixes with zips - preferably around the timeframe the TS mod reaches official status.

data.title: Joining games via the openra:// URL handler doesn't work anymore
data.body: I always get "wrong mod" or "wrong version". Tested on Linux.

data.title: Detonate refactor
data.body: I decided to fix it after Mailaender was kind enough to finish the spicebloom pr. ~~NOTE: WithChargeAnimation is dumb. I'm not really sure how to make it less dumb.~~

data.title: Added pre-multiplied alpha palettes for cloak effects
data.body: This implements the cloak effect known from Tiberian Sun and also applies it to Red Alert. Remember the initial "what are the black holes in the ground" impression when we added cloaking to the camo pillbox.

data.title: Made WithVoxelTurret and WithVoxelBarrel upgradable
data.body: Test case needs to be removed before merge.

data.title: Ship a preview of the TS mod
data.body:
There has been a lot of controversy about where and when the TS and unofficial RA2 mods fit in with respect to our default installation packages and timelines.  The best compromise that I can see is to ship a preview of TS (and possibly also RA2) as an oramod package that interested players can install themselves, without forcing us to compromise on the stability and polish of our default installation.

Depends on #8992.

data.title: Improve support for external mods
data.body:
- [x] Add engine and required-mod version checks. [#8991]
- [x] Support mods loaded from the support directory. [#8992]
- [ ] Support oramod version checks and upgrades from the mod chooser. [#9028]
- [ ] Support oramod installation via an `openra-mod://` URI. [#9029]

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/25518507-improve-support-for-external-mods?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Support mods loaded from the support directory
data.body:
This is another fundamental engine feature for third party mods.  Expecting players to install mods in the main game dir is dangerous, and causes trouble when we release new engine versions.  Loading mods from the support dir fixes most of these problems.

We should support both unpacked mods (in a directory) and packaged mods in a zip renamed to oramod.
Because these mods are effectively data files in a user-owned directory there are no fundamental problems with supporting in-game installation and upgrades for them.

The tricky part is dealing with file paths, as our current mod.yaml syntax defines only `.` for "relative to game exe" and `^` for "relative to support dir".  I propose introducing a `<mod id>:` prefix for referencing files relative to the current or another named mod dir.

e.g. a snippet of the d2k mod may look like:

``` yaml
Assemblies:
    common: OpenRA.Mods.Common.dll
    ra: OpenRA.Mods.RA.dll
    cnc: OpenRA.Mods.Cnc.dll
    d2k: OpenRA.Mods.D2k.dll

ChromeLayout:
    d2k: chrome/install.yaml
    d2k: chrome/ingame.yaml
    ra: chrome/ingame-chat.yaml
    ra: chrome/ingame-diplomacy.yaml
    ra: chrome/ingame-fmvplayer.yaml
    d2k: chrome/ingame-menu.yaml
    ra: chrome/ingame-info.yaml
    ra: chrome/ingame-infoscripterror.yaml
```

data.title: Add mod / engine version dependencies.
data.body:
There is currently no programmatic way for mods to declare what engine version they support.  This causes confusion for players who install outdated mods that then crash.

We can combine this with a mechanism for supporting proper expansion mods to prevent duplication and add support for game expansions like YR to RA2 (as there has been a lot of hostility to the idea of integrating YR into @Phrohdoh's unofficial RA2 mod).

I suggest doing the following:
- Add a `RequiresMods:` block to mod.yaml.  A hypothetical YR mod that extends a standalone RA2 mod could, for example, declare

``` yaml
RequiresMods:
    common: release-20170104
    ra2: 3.0-beta
```
- Add a mod.yaml to the `common` mod dir that supersedes our `all` development mod and stores the "core" engine version.
- Add checks to `ModBrowserLogic` to ensure that the declared mods are available and have their assets installed (depends on #8990).  Display a warning and disable the play button if they are not all available.

data.title: Move asset installation code and UI into the mod chooser.
data.body:
The original plan for our mod chooser has always included asset management, but this second phase has not yet happened.  This is going to be a relatively big job to do fully, but this is a simple first step to get the ball rolling.

I expect the following steps to be involved:
- Cache the `ContentInstaller` mod data inside the `ModMetadata` objects that are read at game start.
- Move the mod installation check from `BlankLoadScreen` to `ModBrowserLogic`, and run it when selecting a new mod in the UI.
- Replace the "Play" button text in the mod chooser with "Install" if installation is required, and open the installation dialog instead of launching the mod.
- Keep a check for missing content in `BlankLoadScreen`, but return to the mod chooser if it fails instead of showing a dialog.
- Adjust the music installation code to also go via the mod chooser.
- Adjust the dialog theme to fit our website-inspired UI.
